abstract: Some e-mails released by Congressional Democrats imply that the Obama administration was leery of Solyndra's prospects and tried to brake confidence.
snippet: Some e-mails released by Congressional Democrats imply that the Obama administration was leery of Solyndra's prospects and tried to brake confidence.
lead_paragraph: At the Caucus blog, Matthew L. Wald provides an update about e-mail messages involving Solyndra, the bankrupt solar manufacturer, released on Monday by House Democrats. The lawmakers' memo was intended to refute the idea that the Obama administration exercised favoritism in extending loan guarantees.

headline.main: Parsing How the White House Helped Solyndra
